model_insight: OLED black pixels consume zero power
interpretation_guidance: Zero cost: OS-level toggle. Effectiveness varies by content (all-white: 0%, all-black: 30%). Avg gain 10.5% assumes 70% dark UI coverage.

model_insight: Screen is typically 30-50% of total power
interpretation_guidance: Highest single-action gain. Brightness: Linear power scaling (100%→50% = -40% power). Adaptive brightness mitigates UX cost.

action: Use WiFi instead of 4G/5G when available
interpretation_guidance: Auto-switching: OS can prioritize WiFi. 4G: 250-400mW vs. WiFi: 150-200mW. 5G SA mode: 500-700mW (worst case).

action: Use power saving mode proactively at 30%
interpretation_guidance: Largest TTE gain but high UX cost (CPU throttled, background restricted). Best at <30% SOC. Reduces P_total by 35% (CPU -15%, screen -10%, network -10%).
120Hz→60Hz: -15% screen power. Gaming UX impact high, but static content unaffected. Adaptive refresh (LTPO) optimal.
GPS: 150-250mW active. But many apps request location in background. System-level permission control critical.
Sync: Wakes radio every 15-30min. Each wake: 5s @ 300mW = 0.42mWh. Daily: ~20mWh. Marginal but cumulative.
Low practicality: Android aggressive killer already active. Manual kill: Temporary (apps restart). Better: Uninstall bloatware.
